title: Estadio Azteca
summary: Estadio Azteca (American Spanish: [esˈtaðjo asˈteka]) is a multi-purpose stadium located in Mexico City. It is the official home of football club Club América, and the Mexico national football team. The stadium sits at an altitude of 2,200 m (7,200 feet) above sea level.[6] With an official capacity of 87,523,[1] it is the largest stadium in Mexico. As of 2018, the stadium also serves as the home of Cruz Azul.[7] The National Football League (NFL) features one game at Estadio Azteca per season as a part of their International Series.
